Generated Narrative with Details

status: draft

date: 2-Sep 2014 5:51

publisher: HL7 FHIR Standard

group

linkId: MedicationDispense

title: Dispensing a medication to a named patient

required: true

group

group

group

group

group

group

group

extension.valueString: Dispensing a medication to a named patient.  This includes a description of the supply provided and the instructions for administering the medication.

group.title: Dispensing a medication to a named patient

extension.valueString: Identifier assigned by the dispensing facility - this is an identifier assigned outside FHIR. null
A code specifying the state of the set of dispense events. null

group.text: in progress | on hold | completed | entered in error | stopped

extension.valueString: A link to a resource representing the person to whom the medication will be given.
The individual responsible for dispensing the medication. null
Indicates the medication order that is being dispensed against. null

question.text: Medication order that authorizes the dispense

extension.valueString: Indicates the details of the dispense event such as the days supply and quantity of medication dispensed.
Identifier assigned by the dispensing facility.   This is an identifier assigned outside FHIR. null
A code specifying the state of the dispense event. null

group.text: in progress | on hold | completed | entered in error | stopped

extension.valueString: Indicates the type of dispensing event that is performed. Examples include: Trial Fill, Completion of Trial, Partial Fill, Emergency Fill, Samples, etc. null

group.text: Trial fill, partial fill, emergency fill, etc.

extension.valueString: The amount of medication that has been dispensed. Includes unit of measure. null

Identifies the medication being administered. This is either a link to a resource representing the details of the medication or a simple attribute carrying a code that identifies the medication from a known list of medications.
The time when the dispensed product was packaged and reviewed. null
The time the dispensed product was provided to the patient or their representative. null
Identification of the facility/location where the medication was shipped to, as part of the dispense event. null
Identifies the person who picked up the medication.  This will usually be a patient or their carer, but some cases exist where it can be a healthcare professional. null
Indicates how the medication is to be used by the patient.

group.title: Medicine administration instructions to the patient/carer

extension.valueString: Additional instructions such as "Swallow with plenty of water" which may or may not be coded. null

The timing schedule for giving the medication to the patient.  The Schedule data type allows many different expressions, for example.  "Every  8 hours"; "Three times a day"; "1/2 an hour before breakfast for 10 days from 23-Dec 2011:";  "15 Oct 2013, 17 Oct 2013 and 1 Nov 2013". null

If set to true or if specified as a CodeableConcept, indicates that the medication is only taken when needed within the specified schedule rather than at every scheduled dose.  If a CodeableConcept is present, it indicates the pre-condition for taking the Medication. null
A coded specification of the anatomic site where the medication first enters the body. null
A code specifying the route or physiological path of administration of a therapeutic agent into or onto a subject. null

A coded value indicating the method by which the medication is introduced into or onto the body. Most commonly used for injections.  Examples:  Slow Push; Deep IV.

Terminologies used often pre-coordinate this term with the route and or form of administration.
The amount of therapeutic or other substance given at one administration event. null
Identifies the speed with which the substance is introduced into the subject. Typically the rate for an infusion. 200ml in 2 hours. null

group.text: Amount of medication per unit of time

extension.valueString: The maximum total quantity of a therapeutic substance that may be administered to a subject over the period of time,  e.g. 1000mg in 24 hours. null

group.text: Upper limit on medication per unit of time

extension.valueString: Indicates whether or not substitution was made as part of the dispense.  In some cases substitution will be expected but doesn't happen, in other cases substitution is not expected but does happen.  This block explains what substitition did or did not happen and why.

group.title: Deals with substitution of one medicine for another

extension.valueString: A code signifying whether a different drug was dispensed from what was prescribed. null
Indicates the reason for the substitution of (or lack of substitution) from what was prescribed. null
The person or organization that has primary responsibility for the substitution.

question.text: Who is responsible for the substitution
